title: Audience & Avatar Discovery Interview
context: Extract experiential data about who resonates with your work to synthesize an avatar profile. Rather than asking you to define your ideal customer abstractly, we'll explore your real experiences working with people to discover patterns that reveal who you naturally connect with and serve best.
synthesis_target: Avatar Ideation Document - Pains, Desires & Beliefs

questions.base_question_text: Think about the person you've most enjoyed working with - could be a client, collaborator, or someone you've helped. Who were they, and what made working with them genuinely enjoyable for you?
questions.research_objective: Identify the human/relational qualities that create great working relationships, beyond just 'good fit' - what makes someone a joy to work with

questions.base_question_text: Now think about a client or customer experience that went really well. Walk me through who they were - what was their situation, background, what were they trying to do?
questions.research_objective: Extract concrete demographics, context, and situation of successful engagements to identify avatar patterns

questions.base_question_text: What was that person struggling with before they found you? What pain or frustration were they feeling?
questions.research_objective: Surface real pain points from observed client situations - emotional realities, not hypotheticals

questions.base_question_text: What did they want to achieve? What was the dream outcome or transformation they were hoping for?
questions.research_objective: Identify desires and motivations from real client conversations - the 'promised land' they're seeking

questions.base_question_text: Think about someone who WASN'T a good fit - a client or prospect that didn't work out. What made them wrong for your work?
questions.research_objective: Define anti-patterns and exclusions to sharpen avatar boundaries - who to actively filter out

questions.base_question_text: What words or phrases have you heard prospects or clients use when describing their situation or problems? What language do they actually use?
questions.research_objective: Capture authentic vocabulary for content hooks and messaging that resonates

questions.base_question_text: When someone decides to work with you, what's usually the trigger? What pushes them from 'interested' to 'let's do this'?
questions.research_objective: Identify buying triggers and decision moments to understand urgency drivers

questions.base_question_text: Where do the people who find you typically hang out? How do they spend their time online or offline?
questions.research_objective: Map lifestyle and behavior patterns for targeting and content distribution
